data.title: Hispanic Association of Colleges and Universities
data.text:
Each spring, the Hispanic Association of Colleges and Universities hosts its Annual National Capitol Forum on Hispanic Higher Education. The two-day Capitol Forum features policy briefings on Hispanic-Serving Institution priorities and delegation visits to Capitol Hill to meet in person with congressional leaders to advocate for HSIs.

Highlights include: Informational sessions about grant opportunities; Impactful plenaries on investments in HSIs; Student Track: The HSInnovators; and congressional meetings.

Whether you're a college president, a student, policymakers, or an ally in the corporate or philanthropic world, your voice and participation are crucial. Together, we can advocate for the resources and policies that HSIs need to thrive.

To access more information about the Capitol Forum, please see the helpful links below:
